case_title: MUHAMMAD HAYAT vs SECRETARY SOCIAL WELFARE, WOMEN DEVELOPMENT AND SPECIAL EDUCATION DEPARTMENT GOVERNMENT OF BALOCHISTAN QUETTA and others
respondant: Secretary Social Welfare, Women Development and Special Education Department Government of Balochistan Quetta
complaint_summary: The appellant challenged the withdrawal of his appointment order dated 14-12-2003 and subsequent termination on 20-12-2004, seeking reinstatement with back benefits.
investigation_summary: The appellant was initially terminated on 14-12-2003 due to procedural objections raised by D.C.O Bolan. He was reinstated but later terminated again on 20-12-2004. Appeals to the Provincial Ombudsman and Governor of Balochistan were filed, resulting in conflicting decisions.
judgment_summary: The Tribunal dismissed the appeal on grounds of non-compliance with mandatory conditions under Section 4 Proviso (a) of the Balochistan Service Tribunals Act, 1974, stating the appellant failed to file a departmental appeal before approaching the Tribunal.
legal_arguments: Non-compliance with Section 4 Proviso (a) of Balochistan Service Tribunals Act, 1974
Temporary nature of appointment and its terminability
Case-law cited by appellant (2011 PLC (C.S.) Page 526) deemed inapplicable
key_issues: Compliance with procedural requirements for appeal
key_points: The appellant was terminated twice from his position.
The Provincial Ombudsman initially reinstated the appellant.
The Governor of Balochistan overturned the Ombudsmanâ€™s decision.
The Tribunal dismissed the appeal due to non-compliance with Section 4 of the Balochistan Service Tribunals Act, 1974.

legal_terms.Proviso: A clause in a statute or contract that qualifies or restricts the main provision.

words_and_phrases.Temporary Appointment: An appointment that is not permanent and can be terminated at any time.

summary_vector_notes: The case revolves around the termination of a temporary appointment and procedural non-compliance in filing appeals. The Tribunal dismissed the appeal due to failure to meet mandatory conditions under Section 4 Proviso (a) of the Balochistan Service Tribunals Act, 1974.
